title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

vmassol - (09:34): mflorea: good morning  
vmassol - (09:34): I was looking for macro translations on l10n.xwiki.org  
vmassol - (09:34): do you know where they are?  
mflorea - (09:39): vmassol: good morning! macro translations are in core  
mflorea - (09:39): let me see  
mflorea - (09:42): vmassol: search for "rendering.macro.groovy" in http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties  
vmassol - (09:42): ok I hadn't realized they were in the main properties file  
silviar joined #xwiki at 09:45  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 09:46  
vmassol - (09:48): I think the release notes are good enough know  
vmassol - (09:48): and we can announce the release  
vmassol - (09:48): wdyt?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:51): Looks nice, thanks for getting a more accurate picture of the registration page given how it's configured.  
vmassol - (09:52): hey hi CalebJamesDeLisl, good to see you back :)  
vmassol - (09:52): sergiu was looking for you yesterday  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:52): Had a broken fiber in town.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:52): No internet.  
vmassol - (09:52): yuck  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:53): I got a lot done though, but it's nice to have the shoutcast blues back :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (09:54): I am just finishing testing the lightbox I broke (what I think Sergiu was looking for me for.)  
vmassol - (09:55): yes probably  
vmassol - (09:55): ok cool  
lucaa left at 10:06 (Quit: Leaving.

lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:29  
flaviusolaru left at 10:30 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
Lukemon - (10:31): How can I reopen an issue? I encountered http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2592 in XE 2.2rc2  
vmassol - (10:33): Lukemon: best is to open a new issue  
vmassol - (10:33): the one you refer to was fixed a long time ago  
vmassol - (10:33): so it's a new problem  
vmassol - (10:33): hence a new issue  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 10:39  
Lukemon - (10:48): ok, done  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 10:49  
tmortagne - (10:49): vmassol: did you had time to do all modifications you wanted on the release note ?  
vmassol - (10:49): yes  
vmassol - (10:50): we can announce  
tmortagne - (10:50): ok sending blog and mail then  
ajay16oct joined #xwiki at 10:53  
ajay16oct - (10:54): can any one help me out here..  
kibaho1 left #xwiki at 10:55  
ajay16oct - (10:55): i want some relevant info abt gsoc 10  
vmassol - (10:56): Lukemon: ok thx  
vmassol - (10:57): ajay16oct: we have some info here http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/ but GSOC 2010 is not started yet  
ajay16oct - (10:57): vmassol u  there  
ajay16oct - (10:57): buddy but from where i get the ideas  
vmassol - (10:58): we haven't listed any project yet since GOC 2010 is not yet started  
ajay16oct - (10:58): there are no proposed ideas in the list  
ajay16oct - (10:58): :(  
vmassol - (10:58): you could propose some idea though and check past years ideas too  
vmassol - (10:58): why are you sad?  
vmassol - (10:59): gsoc 2010 isn't started correct?  
ajay16oct - (10:59): yes  
ajay16oct - (10:59): but i m deeply interested in this ..  
vmassol - (10:59): that's good  
ajay16oct - (10:59): and in the summers i dont have any work..  
lucaa left at 10:59 (Quit: Leaving.  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:00  
vmassol - (11:00): then I suggest you check what we did in the past years (you have links on the page I gave you)  
ajay16oct - (11:00): i sent a mail to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) but the proposed ideas  
tmortagne - (11:00): [ANN] 2.2 is now officially released  
vmassol - (11:00): familiarize yourself with how we do gsoc  
vmassol - (11:01): familiarize yourself with the XWiki project  
vmassol - (11:01): read http://dev.xwiki.org fully  
ajay16oct - (11:01): and what is the application process for it  
vmassol - (11:01): read http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/  
ajay16oct - (11:01): thnx  
ajay16oct - (11:01): :)  
ajay16oct - (11:01): ok ..  
vmassol - (11:01): show interest for xwiki and prove that you're the right person, motivated, etc  
vmassol - (11:01): you can start communicating through the xwiki mailing list  
vmassol - (11:02): express your interest in a given domain, start suggesting stuff, etc  
ajay16oct - (11:02): i m  gud in java  
vmassol - (11:02): well you need to show that :)  
ajay16oct - (11:02): SCJP 5 certified..  
vmassol - (11:02): not just say it  
vmassol - (11:02): ;)  
vmassol - (11:02): so my advice  
vmassol - (11:02): pick a jira issue in http://jira.xwiki.org  
vmassol - (11:02): and provide a patch for it  
vmassol - (11:03): that'll show how good you are  
ajay16oct - (11:03): is it in java  
vmassol - (11:03): you can start with some easy stuff  
vmassol - (11:03): yes  
ajay16oct - (11:03): ?  
ajay16oct - (11:03): thnx you ...  
ajay16oct - (11:04): may i have the honour to know ur name..  
ajay16oct - (11:04): just for knoweledge..  
vmassol - (11:07): Vincent Massol  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 11:11  
anamarias joined #xwiki at 11:12  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 11:14  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:18): Well I was trying to add some screenshots to show how application configuration is going and somehow I managed to knock over the incubator, strange how everything I touch seems to break.  
vmassol - (11:18): incubator is ok for me  
glerouge - (11:21): CalebJamesDeLisl: unfortunately the incubator breaks all the time, it's not just you  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:21): Hmm, looks like it just lost my edit and everything else is fine.  
glerouge - (11:21): if you'd like to try profiling it maybe you can get an access  
tmortagne - (11:21): CalebJamesDeLisl: probably a restart of myxwiki.org  
vmassol - (11:21): glerouge: are you sure?  
vmassol - (11:22): it wasn'"t breaking all the time, there was a wrong restart script that's been retstarting it every 5 minutes  
vmassol - (11:22): apart from this I don't have any stats  
glerouge - (11:23): I wasn't aware of the wrong restart script but I'm aware of the complaints ;)  
tmortagne - (11:23): btw i need to upgrade it to 2.2  
tmortagne - (11:23): doing it now  
vmassol - (11:23): great  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:24): Hah. Firefox refresh (re-post data) to the rescue.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:24): Cool screenshots here. http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/preview/Admin/ApplicationConfig  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:26): meaning here: (view not preview) http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Admin/ApplicationConfig  
tmortagne - (11:33): CalebJamesDeLisl: stoping myxwiki.org, ok for you N  
tmortagne - (11:33): ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:33): sure.  
tmortagne - (11:44): [upgrade] Done  
vmassol - (11:45): jvdrean: would be great to get myxwiki.org watchlist running again  
vmassol - (11:45): tmortagne: ouch  
vmassol - (11:45): home page erased  
tmortagne - (11:45): ha crap  
vmassol - (11:45): and no history!  
vmassol - (11:46): looks like a bug  
vmassol - (11:46): I don't see how you cannot have a history  
glerouge - (11:46): that might indicate a bug in the new import UI interface  
tmortagne - (11:46): i did not choose add version  
flaviusolaru joined #xwiki at 11:48  
tmortagne - (11:48): anyone with home page of myxwiki.org in his browser before the upgrade ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:49): I remember noticing when I did an import that version 1.0 didn't exist, I could only revert to 2.1  
vmassol - (11:49): the first version is always 1.1 caleb  
vmassol - (11:50): (there's no 1.0)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:50): yes 1.1 is what I meant.  
vmassol - (11:50): a long time limitation we want to fix one day ;)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:50): Basically I could only revert to the first alteration of the main page.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:51): Not the page with no alterations.  
glerouge - (11:52): tmortagne  
glerouge - (11:52): once again I think google cache is your friend  
glerouge - (11:52): look for the cache of myxwiki.org…?viewer=code  
tmortagne - (11:52): glerouge: yes i was looking at it  
vmassol - (11:53): http://209.85.229.132/search?q=cache:DJEhUyCWtVgJ:www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/%3Fviewer%3Dcode+myxwiki.org+viewer%3Dcode&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&client=firefox-a  
vmassol - (11:53): I thought I had converted it to 2.0 syntax but maybe not  
tmortagne - (11:54): yes the viewer=code one seems old  
tmortagne - (11:54): ha no it's probably because of the dashboard which is still in 1.0  
vmassol - (11:55): yes but I rmemeber spending quite a lot of time doing teh conversion to 2.0  
vmassol - (11:55): but maybe I reverted in the end  
tmortagne - (11:58): is yellow is normal or coming form google ?  
tmortagne - (11:58): yellow backgroud  
tmortagne - (11:58): <b style="color:black;background-color:#ffff66"> in the content  
tmortagne - (12:00): probably google since it break the velocity  
tmortagne - (12:02): note: i created http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHomeXWikiOrg and included it in http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
vmassol - (12:03): WebHomeMyXWikiOrg would have been slightly better but it's a good idea  
tmortagne - (12:03): ho yes forgot the My  
tmortagne - (12:03): fixing that  
vmassol - (12:04): don't forget to update http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/UpgradesLog  
tmortagne - (12:04): hmm rename UI did not propose me to modify home page include  
vmassol - (12:04): hmm  
vmassol - (12:04): normal  
vmassol - (12:04): it's not a link  
vmassol - (12:04): it's not supported right now  
tmortagne - (12:05): was not sure it was only for link or not  
tmortagne - (12:05): I guess it's because we don't put include in backlinks  
vmassol - (12:07): yes probably  
vmassol - (12:07): something to fix

vmassol - (14:57): good strategy used in google groups: the first message is moderated but subsequent messages go through. We should have some similar strategy for xwiki.org IMO

sdumitriu - (15:39): CalebJamesDeLisl: I usually do like this:  
sdumitriu - (15:39): #\*  
sdumitriu - (15:39): Comment  
sdumitriu - (15:39): \*###  
sdumitriu - (15:39): \*# would leave the \n at the end  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:39): Okay, thanks. I'll do that.

sdumitriu - (22:43): vmassol: Any reason why /xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/CopyDocument exists?  
sdumitriu - (22:44): It's a duplicate of copy.vm  
vmassol - (22:44): no idea  
vmassol - (22:44): have you checked who created it?  
sdumitriu - (22:44): An outdated one, it doesn't have the translation improvements you just did  
vmassol - (22:45): jv created it  
vmassol - (22:45): ah no  
vmassol - (22:45): he modified it  
sdumitriu - (22:46): That's ancient actually

vmassol - (22:46): yes must be old I guess

sdumitriu - (22:46): Was in Admin/CopyDocument
